name: Varjo XR-3
description: Varjo XR-3 is a pro headset with photorealistic 12 MP pass-through, LiDAR depth sensing, and human-eye resolution (70+ PPD) across a 115° FOV. It adds 200 Hz eye tracking, Ultraleap hand tracking, and enterprise-grade ergonomics and security.

name: Doublepoint Developer Kit
description: Doublepoint Developer Kit enables precise wrist and finger gesture recognition through advanced sensors. It supports low-latency, natural input for XR, wearables, and mobile devices, making interactions more intuitive.

name: Nexys A7 FPGA Trainer Board
description: Nexys A7 is an FPGA trainer board built on the AMD Artix-7, featuring a high-performance programmable logic platform with abundant I/O, DDR2 memory, and built-in peripherals, ideal for digital design, embedded systems, and hardware prototyping.

name: Booster_T1
description: Provided by Aaltoes, it is a humanoid with full-force joints and Jetson AGX Orin (200 TOPS) for onboard AI. With RGB-D vision, mic array, 9-axis IMU, ROS2, and a mobile app, it suits research, education, and custom perception/navigation development.

name: Tenstorrent Blackhole™ p100a
description: PCIe board for high performance AI processing with 16 big RISC-V cores and 28 GB of GDDR6 operating at up to 300W in an active-cooled form factor geared for desktop workstations. Supported by Tenstorrent's open source software stack.

name: NVIDIA Jetson Orin Nano Super
description: 67 TOPS Ampere (1024 CUDA, 32 Tensor), 6-core Arm A78AE, 8GB LPDDR5 (102 GB/s), 7-25W, $249. Runs LLMs/VLMs/transformers at the edge, with Pi-friendly onboarding via Jetson/Isaac docs and community; existing kits get the boost via software.

name: Lenovo Legion Tower 5 Gen 10
description: Ryzen 7 7700X + RTX 5070 (12GB), 32GB DDR5-5600, 1TB PCIe 4.0 NVMe on AMD B650 with PCIe 4.0 x16 and M.2. Built for high-FPS 1440p/4K graphics, AI inference, 3D content creation, and streaming/compiling/rendering multitask workflows.

name: AMD Kria KR260 Robotics
description: Built for robotics and industrial applications, it combines high-performance interfaces, native ROS 2 support, and integrated FPGA fabric, enabling roboticists and embedded developers to build adaptive hardware solutions with ease.

name: AMD Kria KV260 Vision
description: Designed for advanced vision applications, it combines powerful processing with integrated FPGA fabric, making it ideal for prototyping smart city, machine vision, security, retail analytics, and industrial solutions.

name: OAK-D Pro
description: Camera equipped with IR illumination and an on-device Neural Network inferencing and Computer Vision capabilities. Good for applications that require high-quality and reliable stereo depth perception in any kind of environment.
